title: Attempts to overturn the 2020 United States presidential election
deleted: On October 5, 2021, news reported that the former President may be blocked from running again in 2024, due to his activities associated with the [[2021 United States Capitol attack|January 6, 2021 atttack on the Capitol]], and his related [[Eastman Memorandum|attempt to overturn the 2020 election]].<ref name="IND-2211005">{{cite news |last=Kilander |first=Gustaf |title=Trump could be blocked from running again, former White House ethics boss says - ‘We should not have to deal with his candidacy in 2024’ |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/us-politics/donald-trump-oval-office-2024-b1933579.html |date=October 5, 2021 |work=[[The Independent]] |accessdate=October 6, 2021 }}</ref>

title: Attempts to overturn the 2020 United States presidential election
Attempts to overturn the 2020 United States presidential election
added: Following the [[2020 United States presidential election|2020 election]] and attempts by Donald Trump and [[Republican Party (US)|Republican]] officials to overturn it, Republican lawmakers initiated a sweeping effort to make voting laws more restrictive.<ref>{{Cite web|last1=Izaguirre|first1=Anthony|last2=Coronado|first2=Acacia|date=January 31, 2021|title=GOP lawmakers seek tougher voting rules after record turnout|url=https://apnews.com/article/bills-voting-rights-elections-coronavirus-pandemic-voter-registration-0e94844d72d2a2bf8b51b1c950bd64fc|url-status=live|website=[[Associated Press]]}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|last=McCaskill|first=Nolan D.|date=March 15, 2021|title=After Trump's loss and false fraud claims, GOP eyes voter restrictions across nation|url=https://www.politico.com/news/2021/03/15/voting-restrictions-states-475732|url-status=live|website=[[Politico]]}}</ref> According to the [[Brennan Center for Justice]], as of March 24, 2021, more than 361 bills that would restrict voting access have been introduced in 47 states,<ref name="Brennan-March">{{Cite web|date=April 1, 2021|title=Voting Laws Roundup: March 2021|url=https://www.brennancenter.org/our-work/research-reports/voting-laws-roundup-march-2021|url-status=live|website=[[Brennan Center for Justice]]}}</ref> with most aimed at limiting [[postal voting|mail-in voting]], strengthening [[Voter identification laws in the United States|voter ID laws]], shortening [[early voting]], eliminating [[Voter registration in the United States#Automatic|automatic]] and [[Voter registration in the United States#Election Day / same-day|same-day voter registration]], curbing the use of [[ballot drop box]]es, and allowing for increased purging of [[Electoral roll|voter rolls]].<ref name="Bill-Tracker">{{Cite web|date=February 24, 2021|title=State Voting Bills Tracker 2021|url=https://www.brennancenter.org/our-work/research-reports/state-voting-bills-tracker-2021|url-status=live|website=[[Brennan Center for Justice]]}}</ref><ref name="NYT-practices"/>
